grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 澄徹【チョウテツ】clearness (e.g. sky), transparency
澄明【チョウメイ】clear and bright
kun reading compounds: 澄む【すむ】to become clear (water, air, etc.), to become transparent, to resonate clearly (e.g. voice), to become serene, to become tranquil, to be free of worries, to pronounce as an unvoiced sound
澄ます【すます】to clear, to make clear, to be unruffled, to look unconcerned, to feign indifference, to look demure, to look prim, to put on airs, to strain (one's ears), to listen carefully
